project.name: The meteor-roles API
project.description: The meteor-roles API: a role-based authorization package for Meteor

Helpers.name: Helpers
Helpers.description:
Convenience functions for use on client.

NOTE: You must restrict user actions on the server-side; any
client-side checks are strictly for convenience and must not be
trusted.

Roles.name: Roles
Roles.description: Provides functions related to user authorization. Compatible with built-in Meteor accounts packages.

Roles.name: Roles
Roles.description:
Role-based authorization compatible with built-in Meteor accounts package.

Stores user's current roles in a 'roles' field on the user object.

classitems.description:
Handlebars helper to check if current user is in at least one
of the target roles.  For use in client-side templates.

NOTE: This helper does not currently support groups.
classitems.name: isInRole

params.name: role
params.description: name of role or comma-seperated list of roles

return.description: true if current user is in at least one of the target roles

classitems.description:
Roles collection documents consist only of an id and a role name.
  ex: { _id:<uuid>, name: "admin" }
Create a new role. Whitespace will be trimmed.
classitems.name: createRole

classitems.description:
Delete an existing role.  Will throw "Role in use" error if any users
are currently assigned to the target role.
classitems.name: deleteRole

classitems.description:
Add users to roles. Will create roles as needed.

NOTE: Mixing grouped and non-grouped roles for the same user
      is not supported and will throw an error.

Makes 2 calls to database:
 1. retrieve list of all existing roles
 2. update users' roles
classitems.name: addUsersToRoles

params.name: users
params.description: id(s) of users to add to roles

params.name: roles
params.description: name(s) of roles/permissions to add users to

params.name: group
params.description:
Optional group name. If supplied, roles will be
                        specific to that group.  
                        The group name '_global' is special and provides a 
                        convenient way to assign blanket roles/permissions
                        across all groups.  The roles/permissions in the 
                        '_global' group will be automatically included in 
                        checks for any group.

params.name: users
params.description: id(s) of users to add to roles

params.name: roles
params.description: name(s) of roles to add users to

params.name: group
params.description:
Optional. Group name. If supplied, only that
                        group will have roles removed.

classitems.description: Check if user has specified permissions/roles
classitems.name: userIsInRole

params.name: user
params.description: Id of user or actual user object

params.name: roles
params.description: Name of role/permission or Array of roles/permissions to check against.  If array, will return true if user is in _any_ role.

params.name: group
params.description:
Optional. Name of group.  If supplied, limits check
                        to just that group & the user's '_global' group, if 
                        any.

return.description: true if user is in _any_ of the target roles

params.name: group
params.description:
Optional name of group to restrict roles to.
                        '_global' group will also be checked.

return.description: Array of user's roles, unsorted. undefined if user not found

classitems.description: Retrieve all users who are in target role
classitems.name: getUsersInRole

params.name: role
params.description:
Name of role/permission.  If array, users 
                           returned will have at least one of the roles
                           specified but need not have _all_ roles.

params.name: group
params.description:
Optional name of group to restrict roles to
                        '_global' group will also be checked.
